The enzyme activity was measured at different concentrations of peak IV (0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5, and 3.0 μg/ml) and different concentrations of tyrosinase (0, 62.5, 125, 250, and 500 U/ml). A linear regression was created in a double reciprocal plot of the reaction rate and the concentration of the substrate. In addition, the Lineweaver–Burk plot was used to determine the type of tyrosinase inhibition according to a previously described method with modifications (Espin et al., 2000). The reaction rate was measured at different concentration of the substrate L‐tyrosine (0.1, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4, and 0.5 mM), and different concentrations of peak IV (0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5, and 3.0 μg/ml).
